EmailTemplate.subject: Keep the broadband bandits at bay
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
${preheader} View as web page <[[{{system.viewAsWebpageLink}}]]> New community broadband networks are popping up all over North America. And cable companies and predatory alternative operators are always looking to steal subscribers. How do you keep these broadband bandits at bay? Find out in our white paper. To keep your customers loyal and keep competitors at bay, you need to invest in new broadband services. The challenge is finding the right balance between how good these services need to be, how quickly they can be provided, and how much it will all cost.
Download this white paper from Nokia <[[https://pages.nokia.com/Fiber.strategies.broadband2.html]]>, the second in a 3-part series, to get a better understanding of these principles. Using business modeling devised by Nokia Bell Labs, understand how technology choices impact:
- CAPEX. - OPEX. - Time-to-market.
With these three fundamentals, you’re well on the way to developing the best investment strategy for your broadband network, namely FTT$ – fiber-to-the-most-economical-point.
